channel.title: Talks By Henry B. Eyring
channel.description: General Conference talks by Henry B. Eyring.

image.title: General Conference talks by Henry B. Eyring.

item.title: Ears to Hear
item.description: On Friday morning, President Hinckley called me to serve as a counselor to Bishop Hales in the Presiding Bishopric. I am grateful for the call and for the knowledge that it is the Savior who makes such calls through his servants in his Church. And I

item.title: The Spark of Faith
item.description: At the close of the last general conference, President Benson said this: “I bless you with increased of the Book of Mormon. I promise you that from this moment forward, if we will daily sup from its pages and abide by its precepts, God will pour out

item.title: Because of Your Steadiness
item.description: From the islands of the Pacific to the highlands of South America, I’ve seen boys working to turn dreams into reality. In fact, I’ve seen it so often that it merges into one image, one picture. It’s of a small boy, maybe nine or ten, in shorts, baref

item.title: Remembrance and Gratitude
item.description: Many of you have had the same experience I have had. And if you haven’t, you will: you will go to a hospital or to a house to comfort someone, and instead they comfort you. Or you try to encourage someone who seems to you to have so little, and yet t

item.title: To Draw Closer to God
item.description: You talk with people every day who say that God does not exist or is far, far away. A woman sat next to me on a plane. I spoke to her. She strained to understand me. When she spoke, her accent almost overpowered her English. In answer to my question,

item.title: “Always Remember Him”
item.description: Many years ago, I went on assignment to Brazil. As part of the trip, I was to travel by car from São Paulo to a conference in a city about two hours distant. A member of the Quorum of the Twelve was going to preside at that conference. I hoped to rid

item.title: To Touch a Life with Faith
item.description: I am grateful that we are assembled as the priesthood of God tonight, presided over by the prophet who holds and exercises the keys of the holy priesthood in all the world. President Hinckley spoke in the Sunday morning session of conference last Apr

item.title: A Legacy of Testimony
item.description: Hearts were touched by the proclamation on the family read by President Hinckley last fall because we want for our families what God wants for them: that they will live in love and righteousness. But in our thoughtful moments we know that we will nee

item.title: Witnesses for God
item.description: The Latter-day Saints are a covenant people. From the day of baptism through the spiritual milestones of our lives, we make promises with God and He makes promises with us. He always keeps His promises offered through His authorized servants, but it

item.title: Finding Safety in Counsel
item.description: We may know that the warning is from the Lord [when] the law of witnesses, authorized witnesses, has been invoked. When the words of prophets seem repetitive, that should rivet our attention.

item.title: “Feed My Lambs”
item.description: The Saints of God have always been under covenant to nourish each other spiritually, especially those tender in the gospel.

item.title: That We May Be One
item.description: The Savior of the world spoke of that unity and how we will have our natures changed to make it possible.

item.title: A Voice of Warning
item.description: Our ability to touch others with our warning voice matters to all who are covenant disciples of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Power of Teaching Doctrine
item.description: We can teach even a child to understand the doctrine of Jesus Christ. It is therefore possible, with God’s help, to teach the saving doctrine simply.

item.title: Do Not Delay
item.description: However difficult our circumstances, we can repent.

item.title: Watch Over and Strengthen
item.description: The Savior will let you feel the love He feels for those you serve. The call is an invitation to become like Him.

item.title: “Write upon My Heart”
item.description: Prayer can provide the shield of protection the parent will want so much for [a child] to have.

item.title: “Watch with Me”
item.description: As you watch over His sheep, your love for Him will grow. And that will increase your confidence and your courage.

item.title: Prayer
item.description: With … faith, we will be able to pray for what we want and appreciate whatever we get. Only with that faith will we pray with the diligence God requires.

item.title: True Friends
item.description: All of us will be tested. And all of us need true friends to love us, to listen to us, to show us the way, and to testify of truth to us.

item.title: Rise to Your Call
item.description: The Lord will guide you by revelation just as He called you. You must ask in faith for revelation to know what you are to do.

item.title: A Child and a Disciple
item.description: The Lord trusts His true disciples. He sends prepared people to His prepared servants.

item.title: An Enduring Testimony of the Mission of the Prophet Joseph
item.description: The Prophet Joseph is an example and a teacher of enduring well in faith. … I thank and love him as the Lord’s prophet of the Restoration.

item.title: In the Strength of the Lord
item.description: We need strength beyond ourselves to keep the commandments in whatever circumstance life brings to us.

item.title: Faith and Keys
item.description: We have to know by inspiration that the priesthood keys are held by those who lead and serve us. That requires the witness of the Spirit.

item.title: Hearts Bound Together
item.description: When you were baptized, your ancestors looked down on you with hope. … They rejoiced to see one of their descendants make a covenant to find them.

item.title: Spiritual Preparedness: Start Early and Be Steady
item.description: The great test of life is to see whether we will hearken to and obey God’s commands in the midst of the storms of life.

item.title: As a Child
item.description: Our natures must be changed to become as a child to gain the strength we must have to be safe in the times of moral peril.

item.title: A Priesthood Quorum
item.description: The strength of a quorum comes in large measure from how completely its members are united in righteousness.

item.title: This Day
item.description: All of us will need His help to avoid the tragedy of procrastinating what we must do here and now to have eternal life.

item.title: God Helps the Faithful Priesthood Holder
item.description: The message may come in words to your mind or in a feeling or both. But it will … give you assurance and guidance in what you must do.

item.title: O Remember, Remember
item.description: “O remember, remember,” Book of Mormon prophets often implored.1 My point is to urge you to find ways to recognize and remember God’s kindness.

item.title: Walk in the Light
item.description: You make choices every day and almost every hour that keep you walking in the light or moving away toward darkness.

item.title: The True and Living Church
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is true, and it lives on.

item.title: Faith and the Oath and Covenant of the Priesthood
item.description: Go forward in faith in keeping your covenants with God and so claim the promise He has made to you with an oath.

item.title: O Ye That Embark
item.description: Our power to carry burdens can be increased more than enough to compensate for the increased service we will be asked to give.

item.title: Our Hearts Knit as One
item.description: The Saints can accomplish any purpose of the Lord when fully united in righteousness.

item.title: Adversity
item.description: I bear you my testimony that God the Father lives. He set a course for each of us that can polish and perfect us to be with Him.

item.title: “Man Down!”
item.description: A feeling of responsibility for others is at the heart of faithful priesthood service.

item.title: The Enduring Legacy of Relief Society
item.description: The history of Relief Society is recorded in words and numbers, but the heritage is passed heart to heart.

item.title: Be Ready
item.description: The preparation that counts will be made by the young men making choices to rise to their great destiny as priesthood servants for God.

item.title: Our Perfect Example
item.description: The message of the restored gospel of Jesus Christ is that we can and must expect to become better as long as we live.

item.title: Help Them on Their Way Home
item.description: We help God’s children best by providing ways to build faith in Jesus Christ and His restored gospel when they are young.

item.title: Act in All Diligence
item.description: We are to learn our duty from the Lord, and then we are to act in all diligence, never being lazy or slothful.

item.title: Serve with the Spirit
item.description: Let us do whatever is required to qualify for the Holy Ghost as our companion.

item.title: Trust in God, Then Go and Do
item.description: You show your trust in Him when you listen with the intent to learn and repent and then you go and do whatever He asks.

item.title: A Living Testimony
item.description: Testimony requires the nurturing by the prayer of faith, the hungering for the word of God in the scriptures, and the obedience to the truth.

item.title: Opportunities to Do Good
item.description: The Lord’s way to help those in temporal need requires people who out of love have consecrated themselves and what they have to God and to His work.

item.title: Learning in the Priesthood
item.description: If you will be diligent and obedient in the priesthood, treasures of spiritual knowledge will be poured out upon you.

item.title: Preparation in the Priesthood: “I Need Your Help”
item.description: Don’t worry about how inexperienced you are or think you are, but think about what, with the Lord’s help, you can become.

item.title: A Witness
item.description: The Book of Mormon is the best guide to learn how well we are doing and how to do better.

item.title: Mountains to Climb
item.description: If we have faith in Jesus Christ, the hardest as well as the easiest times in life can be a blessing.

item.title: Families under Covenant
item.description: There is nothing that has come or will come into your family as important as the sealing blessings.

item.title: Help Them Aim High
item.description: With your guidance, those you lead will be able to see, want, and believe they can achieve their full potential for service in God’s kingdom.

item.title: Where Is the Pavilion?
item.description: The pavilion that seems to intercept divine aid does not cover God but occasionally covers us. God is never hidden, yet sometimes we are.

item.title: “Come unto Me”
item.description: By His words and His example, Christ has shown us how to draw closer to Him.

item.title: We Are One
item.description: I pray that wherever we are and whatever duties we have in the priesthood of God, we will be united in the cause to bring the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Bind Up Their Wounds
item.description: I pray that we may prepare ourselves to give whatever priesthood service the Lord may set before us on our mortal journey.

item.title: To My Grandchildren
item.description: There is one overarching commandment that will help us to meet the challenges and lead to the heart of a happy family life.

item.title: Daughters in the Covenant
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages women to keep their covenants, including those made at baptism, as they progress along the path back to Heavenly Father.

item.title: A Priceless Heritage of Hope
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages us to leave an inheritance of hope for those who will follow our example.

item.title: The Priesthood Man
item.description: Henry B. Eyring teaches men how they can follow—and be—examples of selfless priesthood service.

item.title: The Preparatory Priesthood
item.description: President Henry�B. Eyring offers counsel to those who help Aaronic Priesthood holders prepare for continuing priesthood service.

item.title: Continuing Revelation
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring testifies that we can receive personal, confirming revelation about the teachings and counsel of our leaders.

item.title: The Comforter
item.description: Henry B. Eyring describes how our baptismal covenant inspires us to extend the Savior's compassion to those who are carrying life's heavy burdens.

item.title: “Is Not This the Fast That I Have Chosen?”
item.description: Henry B. Eyring teaches about the temporal and spiritual blessings of fasting and fast offerings.

item.title: Priesthood and Personal Prayer
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring teaches priesthood holders that as they humbly pray and seek the Spirit, God will help them know what to say and do.

item.title: You Are Not Alone in the Work
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring reminds priesthood holders that priesthood service is about helping the children of God return to Him and that the Lord is with them in that service.

item.title: The Holy Ghost as Your Companion
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages members to seek the companionship of the Holy Ghost, who provides protection, guidance, and comfort.

item.title: Trust in That Spirit Which Leadeth to Do Good
Where Two or Three Are Gathered
That He May Become Strong Also
item.description: President Eyring encourages Melchizedek Priesthood holders to help others, especially Aaronic Priesthood holders, prepare for future service.

item.title: Gratitude on the Sabbath Day
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Sabbath day is a time to be grateful for blessings and to remember and fulfill our covenant to serve others.

item.title: “My Peace I Leave with You”
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Holy Ghost brings us peace, helps us remember past spiritual experiences, leads us to do good, and inspires unity and love.

item.title: Gathering the Family of God
item.description: President Eyring teaches about the importance of gathering the family of God through family history and temple work.

item.title: “Walk with Me”
item.description: President Eyring teaches priesthood holders that the Lord magnifies and strengthens them as they “walk with” Him in their priesthood service.
